text: Baishya Saha is a Bengali Hindu trading caste traditionally known to have the occupation of grocers, shopkeepers, and dealers of various goods. Some are money lenders and farmers. Some use Saha as their surname, but others use Bhowmik, Chowdhury, Das, Majumder, Roy, Mallick, Poddar, Roy Chowdhury, Sarkar, and Sikder, among others. ==References== Category:Bengali Hindu castes Category:Social groups of West Bengal
title: Baishya Saha
